intro: Pseudolysimachion schmidtianum f. linearilobum, commonly known as the Schmidt's false lysimachia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Primulaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to botanical gardens and alpine plant collections.
